articles.title: Greetings to President of Maldives
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Maldives
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Mohamed Nasheed, President of Maldives, on its independence day.
					 The message sincerely wished the President and people of Maldives success in their work for independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Liberian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Liberian President
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, President of Liberia, on its independence day.
					Kim in the message sincerely wished the President great success in his noble work to consolidate peace and stability of the country and achieve its development.

articles.title: S. Korean "Ministry of Unification's" White Paper Dismissed
articles.content:
S. Korean "Ministry of Unification's" White Paper Dismissed
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The puppet ministry of Unification of south Korea in its recent "2009 white paper on unification" let loose a string of sheer jargons that last year it worked hard for ensuring peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and "improving the inter-Korean relations" and 2008 was a "year of adjustment for establishing new south-north relations."
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in its information bulletin No. 953 issued on Friday termed the rhetoric let loose by the puppet ministry of Unification an intolerable mockery and insult to all the Koreans and public opinion at home and abroad and shameless hypocrisy.
					
					 As universally known, the north-south relations and the situation on the Korean Peninsula have deteriorated with each passing day since the emergence of the Lee Myung Bak regime, the bulletin said, and went on:
					
					 The reality patently proves that the above-said white paper is nothing but an anti-reunification document veiled with the signboard of "unification" and a hypocritical one as it twisted the nature of the situation.
					
					 The puppet rulers are now busy spreading rumors peppered with all sorts of lies and fabrications in a bid to prop up at any cost the fascist ruling system shaking to its very foundation and evade their responsibility for having pushed the inter-Korean relations to an extreme phase. These moves, however, will only bring into bolder relief their true colors as incompetents and hypocrites. 
					
					 With no sleight of hand can the said ministry shake off the ill-fame of being a "ministry for division" and "ministry for confrontation" as it acts a shock brigade in inciting confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: Slave Labor Forced by Aso Family upon Great Many Koreans Confirmed
articles.content:
Slave Labor Forced by Aso Family upon Great Many Koreans Confirmed
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Association of Korean Victims of Forcible Drafting and Their Bereaved Families released a survey report on Saturday on the basis of a recent confirmation of the facts that a large number of Koreans were forced to do slave labor at "the Aso Coal Mines" run by the ancestors of Japanese Prime Minister Taro Aso and horrible damage done to them.
					 According to the report, the Aso family took an active part in the Japanese imperialist aggression forces' scenario to convert Korea into a war supply base and a military bridgehead for invasion of the continent and took the lead in exploiting the Koreans and looting natural resources abundant in Korea.
					
					 Takichi Aso, great-grandfather of Taro Aso, was known to be the founder of the "Aso Group". He developed Jikuho coal fields in the Kyushu area at a time when there was a rapid growth of the demand for coal essential for securing materiel for a war of aggression, thus raking up huge profits. He gradually stretched his tentacles to railways and even to the financial field.
					
					 From early in the 1920s till the defeat of Japanese imperialism the Aso family took a great many Koreans to its coal mines and forced them to do hard slave labor.
					
					The number of the Koreans who were drafted to Japanese coal mines from autumn of 1939 to 1941 reached at least 58,000. Among them were more than 21,000 Koreans who were taken away to the Jikuho area of Fukuoka Prefecture where the "Aso Coal Mines" were concentrated.
					
					 Over 150,000 Koreans were drafted to the coal mines in the Jikuho area of Fukuoka Prefecture between 1939 and 1945 and not a few of them were taken away to the "Aso Coal Mines".
					
					 The Aso Coal Mining Co. Ltd., took away Koreans to the "Aso Coal Mines" under various signboards of "recruitment" from early in the 1920s in conspiracy with the old Japanese government and forcibly drafted and kidnapped Koreans under the guise of "government good offices", "labor conscription", etc. after the promulgation of the "state general mobilization law".
					
					 Recorded in the diagram on forcible drafting of Koreans in the document titled "top secret, March 1944, paper on Korean workers in Japan " contained in a "prefectural official document" of Fukuoka Prefecture is that young and middle aged Koreans were taken away to the "Aso Coal Mines" in the prefecture and their number reached 7,996, among them 4,919 deserters and 56 dead.
					
					 The Japanese government and businesses have neither admitted nor redeemed the forcible drafting of Koreans and forced labor committed in the past but denied and justified them, keen on the moves to revive militarism and realize the ambition for overseas expansion. It is Prime Minister of Japan Taro Aso who is taking the lead in such moves.
					
					 Japan's settlement of its past crimes, in essence, constitutes a core issue of the DPRK-Japan relations because it is obliged to make an honest apology and reparation for all the manpower, mental and material damage done to the Korean people in the past. 
					
					 Prime Minister Aso and his government and Japanese businesses should thoroughly probe the truth about all the crimes committed against the Korean people in the past and open them to the public. They should, at the same time, make an honest apology and reparation to the dead and the bereaved families, find out remains of all those killed and get them buried in their birthplaces and the places where their families live according to the wishes of the bereaved families and ferret out the criminals responsible for them and severely punish them according to their responsibilities.
					
					 Aso had better take a political decision to settle them as early as possible before it is too late.

articles.title: Myth of U.S. "Mightiness" Shattered in Korea
articles.content:
Myth of U.S. "Mightiness" Shattered in Korea
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Fifty-six years have passed since the Korean people won a victory against U.S. imperialism on July 27.
					 Whenever they greet this day, the army and people of Korea are recollecting with deep emotion the history when they had won a great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, smashing the myth of the U.S. imperialists' "mightiness" into smithereens.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists mobilized more than 2 million troops and the then advanced military equipment in the three-year-long Korean war. But the "ever-victorious division", "B-29" aircraft that they called "fortress in the air" and hundreds of warships of the 7th Fleet and its navy in the Far East including the battleship Missouri could not save the U.S. from the fate of defeat.
					
					 The Korean People's Army broke through the defensive position along the River Kum the enemy loudly advertised as "the line of no retreat" and the strongest in-depth position, thus destroying the U.S. 24th division renowned as an "ever-victorious division" in a twinkle.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists made desperate efforts to check the advance of a division of the People's Army with the mobilization of military forces three times greater than the KPA division's and tanks, artillery pieces and other modern military hardware five times that of the latter. But they could not save U.S. soldiers trembling with despair and fear of death locked in the "Pusan bridgehead" and sustained a miserable defeat.
					
					 The "general Christmas offensive", which was launched with the mobilization of five army corps allegedly to "put an end to the Korean war", ended in the heaviest fiasco unprecedented in the history of the U.S. army by the KPA tactics of forming the second front in the enemy's rear.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' military and technological superiority was also impotent in the sky and the sea.
					
					 The U.S. air force, which lost twenty B-29s in air battles for a week, stopped the day flight in the sky above the areas north of Pyongyang from then.
					
					 Seamen of the KPA sank the heavy cruiser of 17,000-ton "Baltimore" and damaged a 12,000-ton light cruiser of the U.S. imperialists in the sea off Jumunjin only with four torpedo boats.
					
					 The Korean people won the brilliant victory by defeating the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world. This inspires the Korean people with the conviction in victory today when imperialism remains and the anti-imperialist confrontation continues.

articles.title: U.S. Imperialists' Indiscriminate Bombing during Korean War
articles.content:
U.S. Imperialists' Indiscriminate Bombing during Korean War
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists turned the towns and villages of the northern half of Korea into ashes during the Korean war (June of 1950 to July of 1953).
					 In an attempt to destroy everything of the country and exterminate the entire Korean nation, they perpetrated indiscriminate bombing over the towns and villages in gross violation of international laws and humanitarian principles.
					
					 For three years of the war, the aggressors dropped bombs of hundreds of thousands of tons over the northern half of Korea and showered a lot of napalm and rocket bombs and machine-gun bullets upon it.
					
					 They dropped more than 428,000 bombs only in Pyongyang City on over 1,400 occasions in the whole period of the war.
					
					The indiscriminate bombings destroyed at least 8,700 factories, manufacturing buildings and production equipment and damaged hundreds of thousands of hectares of cropland, with the result that 90,000 hectares of cultivated land decreased.
					
					 The destruction of power stations and reservoirs was also indescribable.
					
					 The U.S. bombers destroyed or burnt down national cultural relics in a big way and indiscriminately bombed theaters, cinemas, libraries and other cultural facilities and churches, too.
					
					 The hospitals with red cross mark were not ruled out.
					
					 In 1951 alone, more than 30 hospitals and clinics were bombed only in Pyongyang City.
					
					 The U.S. bombing raids unprecedented in the world history of war reduced the DPRK to ashes to the letter.
					
					All the Korean army and people will never forget the fiendish barbarities perpetrated by the U.S. imperialists and will take revenge a hundredfold.

articles.title: Revolutionary Site Associated with Exploits of President for Victory in War
articles.content:
Revolutionary Site Associated with Exploits of President for Victory in War
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Lots of servicepersons of the Korean People's Army, people from all walks of life and school youth and children are visiting the Jonsung Revolutionary Site located at the foot of picturesque Moran Hill on the occasion of the 56th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War (July 27, 1953).
					 The Jonsung Revolutionary Site is a significant place where President  Kim Il Sung stayed and worked from the beginning of Juche 40 (1951) to the middle of December Juche 42 (1953).
					
					 In this place, the President put forward the outstanding strategic and tactical policies for the victory in the war, guided the work for strengthening the Party and the people's government and stabilizing the people's living and worked out the grand plan of postwar rehabilitation and construction.
					
					 The site has the outside revolutionary site and inside revolutionary site (tunnel).
					
					 The outside revolutionary site includes the office room where he worked, the house where he examined and approved the armistice agreement to be signed, the office room of the Military Commission, the mess hall, etc. And the inside revolutionary site includes his office room, the assembly room, the mess hall and several rooms for cabinet departments of the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean people have arranged the Jonsung Revolutionary Museum and erected a monument to his revolutionary activities with utmost care to convey to the rising generations the immortal exploits of the President who had led the war to victory.
					
					 The mosaic mural on the theme of "Comrade Kim Il Sung, the iron-willed brilliant commander who defeated the U.S. imperialists" was recently unveiled in the Jonsung Revolutionary Site. And new data on revolutionary activities, historic relics and mementoes were supplemented to the museum recently on the principle of historicism.
					
					 His outside office room, the office room of the Military Commission, the ground in front of the tunnel historic site and others were restored and the then spring was newly discovered and preserved.
					
					 The photograph showing the President examining and approving the armistice agreement document is lighted by fluorescent device and other photographs are also preserved more brightly with due respect. And the data on revolutionary activities and historic relics have been displayed anew.

articles.title: General Strike of Press Trade Union Supported in S. Korea
articles.content:
General Strike of Press Trade Union Supported in S. Korea
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Teachers Union of south Korea (Jongyojo) issued a statement on July 21 in support of the Press Trade Union now on a general strike protesting against the Lee Myung Bak group's moves to railroad the evil bill on media through the "National Assembly."
					 The statement said:
					
					 Its general strike is a struggle to defend democracy from the authorities' moves to put all media under the control of conservative media and big businesses in a bid to ensure their long-term office.
					
					 The Lee group replaced the chiefs of important media institutions with its confidants in an effort to put the media under its control from the outset of its office and took fascist actions to suppress the media organizations and persons incurring its displeasure.
					
					 The desperate moves of the Lee group to enact an evil law on media are aimed to blindfold and deafen the people who wish to know truth and use media as a means for the upkeep of its power and thus mislead the public opinion and reinforce its power base.
					
					 Expressing positive support for the members of the Press Trade Union in their general strike to defend democracy in defiance of crackdown and persecution, the statement declared that Jongyojo would struggle in solidarity with their action.

articles.title: Struggle against Lee Myung Bak's Dictatorship Flayed
articles.content:
Struggle against Lee Myung Bak's Dictatorship Flayed
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea held a rally outside the building of the puppet National Assembly and issued a statement on July 22 in protest against the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors' railroading of the evil bill on media.
					 The statement recalled that on the same day the Lee "government" and the "Grand National Party" railroaded the undemocratic and unpopular evil bill on media through the NA while prevailing over lawmakers from the opposition parties by force.
					
					 It contended that the bill railroaded in disregard of the people's will never be accepted.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak conservative ruling forces are scheming to gratify their ambition for long-term office even by putting media under their control while trampling upon democracy of society, serving only the privileged circle and pushing the inter-Korean relations to confrontation and war crisis, the statement charged.
					
					 With any desperate effort the Lee group will never stifle the population and the history, the statement said, declaring that the solidarity would wage a struggle to get the evil law nullified in solidarity with all other patriotic people.
					
					 The statement expressed the will to intensify the all-out struggle for democracy of the society and thus wipe out the Lee group of traitors without fail.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Foreign Figures
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Meetings, remembrance meetings, lectures, round-table talks, book and photo exhibitions and film shows were held in China, Mexico, Thailand, Democratic Congo and Syria between July 1 and 7 on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					Displayed in the venues of functions were works of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal exploits and books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the C.C., the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, at a meeting said that Kim Il Sung led the anti-Japanese armed struggle and the Fatherland Liberation War to victory, liberating the country and defending the dignity and sovereignty of the nation. The President turned the DPRK into an invincible socialist power, independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence, the speaker added.
					
					 Songchit Pullarp, chairman of the Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea of Thailand, at a remembrance meeting referred to the fact that Kim Il Sung devoted his all to the freedom and happiness of the people and the prosperity of the country. 
					
					 Nzemba Yangana, chairman of the Youth Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Democratic Congo, in a lecture noted that Kim Il Sung shared weal and woe with the people, regarding it as his maxim to believe in people as in Heaven and always finding himself among them. His whole life was dedicated to the people only, he stressed.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the functions held in Thailand and Democratic Congo.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Dilip Barua, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), issued a statement on July 20 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 He noted in the statement that President Kim Il Sung led to victory the Korean people in the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War by putting forward his original military idea and outstanding strategy and tactics.
					
					 The shining victory won by the Korean people in the sacred war against the U.S. served as an example of heroism in realizing global independence, the statement pointed out, and continued:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are now persisting in their moves to start another war of aggression to retrieve the ignominious defeat they suffered in the last Korean war.
					
					 The recent positive measures taken by the DPRK for self-defence amount to an exercise of a legitimate right as they do not contravene any international law. We voice firm solidarity with the Korean people in their struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country.
					
					 The statement called upon all the peace-loving people in the world to firmly unite to decisively frustrate the moves of the imperialist forces for aggression and extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their heroic struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country and ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: CRPP condena a ministerio de Reunificacion de Sur de Corea
articles.content:
CRPP condena a ministerio de Reunificacion de Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ATCC) -- En la supuesta "carta blanca de reunificacion de 2009" publicada recientemente, el ministerio titere de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea dijeron absurdamente que en el ano pasado "hicieron esfuerzos" por la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y por desarrollar las relaciones intercoreanas y que el ano 2008 fue un "periodo de coordinacion para establecer las nuevas relaciones Sur-Norte".
					Tales sofisterias son intolerable burla, insulto y descarado engano a todos los coreanos y la opinion publica interna y externa.
					
					Senalo asi el Secretariado del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria, en la informacion No.953, publicada el dia 24 y continuo:
					
					Como sabe todo el mundo, despues de la aparicion del "poder" de Lee Myung Bak, las relaciones N-S y la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana se tornan cada dia mas empeoradas.
					
					La realidad demuestra fehacientemente que la "carta blanca" no pasa de ser documento falso e intrigante que abusa del rotulo de "reunifacion" y tergiversa la esencia del problema.
					
					Ahora los gobernantes surcoreanos recurren a todos los medios y metodos para mantener de todas maneras el sistema de su dominacion fascista que se sacude de raices y liberarse de sus culpas de haber empeorado al extremo las relaciones N-S. Pero, revelaran solo su naturaleza llena de incapacidad y falsedad. 
					
					Por mas perversamente que actue el ministerio titere de Reunificacion del Sur de Corea, brigada de choque en la confrontacion con la RPDC, no se puede quitarse de la deshonra del "ministerio de division", "el de confrontacion".

articles.title: Publicado informe sobre crimenes en "Minas Carboniferas Aso"
articles.content:
Publicado informe sobre crimenes en "Minas Carboniferas Aso"
						
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ATCC) -- La Asociacion Coreana de Victimas de Arresto Forzoso y Familiares hizo publico el dia 25 el informe sobre la investigacion sobre los datos referentes al trabajo esclavista y danos impuestos a numerosos coreanos en el pasado en las "Minas Carboniferas Aso" administradas por los antepasados del actual premier japones Taro Aso.
					Segun el documento, el clan de Aso se incorporo activamente en las maniobras de las fuerzas agresoras imperialistas de Japon  tendentes a convertir Corea en una base de abastecimiento y trampolin militar para la agresion al continente asiatico y se puso en la delantera en explotar al pueblo coreano y saquear los abundantes recursos naturales de Corea.
					
					El bisabuelo del actual premier japones, Takichi Aso, considerado como fundador del "Grupo Aso", gano fabulosas sumas mediante la explotacion de la cuenca carbonifera Jikuho de la zona de Kyushu cuando habia crecido bruscamente la demanda de carbon necesario al aseguramiento de los materiales belicos para la agresion, y extendio poco a poco sus garras a las ramas ferroviaria y financiera.
					
					Desde el principio de la decada de 1920 hasta la derrota del imperialismo japones en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, los Asos sometieron a los trabajos de esclavitud a numerosos coreanos arrastrados a las minas de carbon de su propiedad.
					
					Desde otono de 1939 hasta 1941, el numero de los coreanos trasladados en contra de su voluntad a las minas de carbon de Japon superan 58 mil y mas de 21 mil de ellos se asentaron en la region de Jikuho del departamento de Fukuoka donde estaban concentrados las "Minas Carboniferas Aso".
					
					En el periodo 1939-1945, la cifra de tales coreanos llego a mas de 150 mil.
					
					En contubernio con el gobierno japones de entonces, la Compania Minera Aso S. A. llevo a los coreanos a las "Minas Carboniferas Aso" a partir de los principios de la decada de 1920 seduciendolos con la propaganda de "contratacion" de varios tipos.
					
					  Despues de la promulgacion de la "ley de movilizacion general del Estado", les arresto y secuestro por la fuerza por conceptos de la "mediacion del gobierno", el "reclutamiento", etc.
					
					Una lamina sobre el arresto forzado de los coreanos fue adjuntada en el documento: "Secreto absoluto, la tabla de los trabajadores coreanos inmigrados en marzo de 1944, Seccion especial de la policia secreta", el cual fue catalogado en el archivo del gobierno del departamento de Fukuoka.
					
					Segun ella, en ese departamento fueron las "Minas Carboniferas Aso" donde estaban concentrados el mayor numero de los jovenes y adultos coreanos. Especificamente, de 7 mil 996 en total, se dieron a la fuga 4 mil 919 y murieron 56.
					
					Pese a esta realidad, el gobierno y las empresas de Japon no reconocen ni liquidan hasta hoy ese crimen del pasado.
					
					Al contrario, lo niegan y lo justifican recrudeciendo sus maniobras para resucitar el militarismo y satisfacer su ambicion expansionista a ultramar.
					
					Al frente de esta campana, esta precisamente el actual premier Taro Aso.
					
					El problema de la liquidacion del pasado criminal de Japon constituye lo esencial de las relaciones RPDC-Japon.
					
					Es decir, ese pais isleno debe pedir disculpas por todas las perdidas humanas, espirituales y materiales en detrimento del pueblo coreano y recompensarlas cabalmente.
					
					El premier Aso, el gobierno y las empresas de Japon deben investigar y publicar con toda claridad los verdaderos aspectos de todos esos crimenes antieticos, pedir disculpas e indemnizar cabalmente a las victimas y sus familiares.
					
					Ademas, tienen que hallar los restos mortales de todos los fallecidos coreanos y enterrarlos en sus tierras natales y los lugares donde habitan sus familiares segun el deseo de estos.
					
					Por ultimo, hay que buscar a los criminales involucrados en el caso y castigarlos severamente acorde a sus responsabilidades.
					
					Aso debe tomar, antes de que se haga tarde, la decision politica para resolver este problema.

articles.title: Indiscriminados bombardeos de los yanquis durante guerra coreana
articles.content:
Indiscriminados bombardeos de los yanquis durante guerra coreana
						
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ATCC) -- Durante la pasada guerra coreana (de junio de 1950 a julio de 1953), los imperialistas yanquis bombardearon indiscriminadamente las ciudades y aldeas de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea violando las normas del derecho internacional y los principios humanitarios con el objetivo de destruir lo todo y exterminar a la nacion coreana.
					Durante los 3 anos de la guerra, ellos usaron en el asesinato y la destruccion cientos de miles de toneladas de bombas de diferentes tipos, como la de napalm, el proyectil-cohete y la metralla. 
					
					Solo en la ciudad de Pyongyang cayeron mas de 428 mil bombas en mas de mil 400 ocasiones.
					
					Tal bombardeo dejo como saldo mas de 8 mil 700 fabricas, talleres y equipos de produccion destruidos y cientos de miles de hectareas de la tierra cultivable perjudicadas, de ellas 90 mil hectareas perdidas.
					
					Quedaron destruidas de gravedad tambien las centrales electricas y las presas.
					
					Los invasores yanquis no vacilaron en tirar  bombas sobre los patrimonios culturales de la nacion coreana, los teatros, cines, bibliotecas y otras instalaciones culturales e iglesias.
					
					Los hospitales con el signo de la cruz roja no fueron una excepcion.
					
					Solo en 1951, se destruyeron mas de 30 hospitales y clinicas en Pyongyang.
					
					El bombardeo de los yanquis sin precedente en la historia mundial de guerras redujo a cenizas a la RPDC.
					
					Todo el ejercito y todo el pueblo de Corea redoblan la voluntad de vengarse mil veces de esos horribles crimenes.

articles.title: Se hizo anicos en Corea el mito de "supremacia" de yanquis
articles.content:
Se hizo anicos en Corea el mito de  "supremacia" de  yanquis
Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ATCC) -- Transcurren 56 anos desde cuando en Corea se tiraron el 27 de julio las salvas de felicitacion por haber derrotado a los imperialistas norteamericanos.
					En visperas de esa efemeride, el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea recuerdan con gran emocion la historia de la victoria en la pasada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (el 25 de junio de 1950-el 27 de julio de 1953).
					
					En esta contienda se hizo anicos el mito de la "supremacia" de los imperialistas norteamericanos.
					
					Durante los tres anos de la guerra, los imperialistas norteamericanos movilizaron mas de 2 millones de efectivos, los equipos y materiales de guerra mas modernizados hasta entonces. Mas, no les salvaron la "division invencible", los "fenices del cielo" como "B-29", la septima flota incluso el buque de guerra "Missouri", ni centenares de buques de la Marina del Extremo Oriente. 
					
					Las posiciones defensivas del rio Kumgang que los yanquis calificaban de "inexpugnables" fueron conquistadas sin dificultad por el EPC, de manera que fue aniquilada en un instante la 24a division norteamericana que se enorgullecia de "division invencible".
					
					Los yanquis se desesperaron para detener el avance de una division del EPC, valiendose de sus uniformados y tanques tres y cinco veces mayores, respectivamente, pero no pudieron evitar el amargo fracaso y se quedaron desesperados y tristes en el "trampolin de Pusan".
					
					Para "finalizar la guerra coreana" desplegaron la "ofensiva general de Navidad" movilizando a los efectivos de 5 cuerpos, pero esta termino como la "derrota sin precedente en la historia de la fuerza terrestre" por la formacion del segundo frente del EPC en la retaguardia enemiga.
					
					La supremacia tecnico-militar de los yanquis no ejercio influencia positiva tanto en el cielo como en los mares. 
					
					En una batalla aerea la fuerza aerea estadounidense perdio durante una semana sus 20 "fenices del cielo". Desde entonces dejo el vuelo  diurno en los espacios aereos al norte de Pyongyang. 
					
					En las aguas maritimas de Jumunjin los marinos del EPC hundieron con 4 torpederos el crucero pesado estadounidense "Baltimore" con capacidad de 17 mil toneladas y destruyeron un crucero ligero con capacidad de 12 mil toneladas.
					
					Hasta la fecha en que existen los imperialistas y sigue la confrontacion antiimperialista, en Corea manifiesta eterno poder vital el brillante triunfo en la pasada guerra coreana contra los imperialistas norteamericanos que se jactaban de la "supremacia" en el mundo.
